Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Motion Hearing as to Juan Figueroa-Cabrera (33) held on 12/22/2015 re 298 MOTION for Third Party Custodian filed by Juan Figueroa-Cabrera. Present were AUSA Laura Montes and defense counsel Ramon Gonzalez. The defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The issue brought forth in the aforementioned motion was discussed. After hearing the parties and from Ms. Migdalia Figueroa, The Court advised the defendant that any other violation will entail a revocation of his condition of release. The Court imposed the following conditions of release:Third Party Custodian, Migdalia Figueroa, to be qualified by USPO, bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's signature, mental health evaluation and treatment for anger management issues, he shall continue or actively seek employment, drug testing and curfew from 8:00 PM to 6:00 AM. Standard conditions of release were also imposed. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 11:00 am. Hearing held at 11:25 am. Hearing ended at 11:33 am. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. Minute for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste: Change of Plea Hearing as to Juan Figueroa-Cabrera (33) held on 2/9/2016. Presen: AUSA Laura Montes, Atty. Ramon Gonzalez. Defendant is OB, present in court and is being assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. Plea entered by Juan Figueroa-Cabrera (33) Guilty Count 1. 427 Motion Requesting a Warrant of Arrest was discussed. Defense counsel requested that defendant's cousin be considered for third party custodian. Government replied. The Court referred the 427 Motion Requesting a Warrant of Arrest to Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno to reevaluate if another TPC can be qualified. If the issue cannot be resolved, Magistrate Judge Carreno may commit the defendant to MDC until an arrangement for bail and supervision can be reached. Sentencing Hearing set for 5/10/2016 09:30 AM in Courtroom 7 before Judge Jose A. Fuste. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)(Court Interpreter Janis Palma.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 12:02.Hearing ended at 12:38. (dv) Modified on 2/9/2016 to remove incorrect security (nat). Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Motion Hearing as to Juan Figueroa-Cabrera (33) held on 2/11/2016 re 427 INFORMATIVE Motion filed by U.S. Probation Officer. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Ramon Gonzalez, and USPO Helga Rojas. Defendant is on bond, present in court, and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel informed the court that defendant is working and studying. Sidebar held with USPO Helga Rojas. The Government does not object that defendant remain on bail. After hearing the parties, the Court imposed the following new conditions of release: curfew Mondays thru Thursdays from 10pm to 6:00am and Fridays from 6pm to Mondays 6:00am, home incarceration during the weekends, can attend church and family activities pre-approved and coordinated with the Probation Officer, third party custodian Mari Del Carmen Pagan-Rosario to be qualified, and same conditions of release as before. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 10:30. Hearing held at 10:28. Hearing ended at 10:39. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (ari) (Entered: 02/16/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno- Coll:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Bond and Bond Revocation Hearing as to Ashley Flores-Carter (8) held on 2/25/2016. Present were AUSA Aaron Howell, AUSA Laura Montes and defense counsel Javier Morales. The defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The Government proffered as to the significant violations of bail conditions committed by the defendant. The Government presented exhibit 1 as evidence and it was admitted by the Court. Defense counsel contested the allegations and argued in favor of keeping the same conditions of release. After having heard the parties, the Court revoked bond conditions. Defendant shall remain under custody. Hearing held at 3:10 pm. Hearing ended at 3:25 pm. (cmd) Modified on 3/3/2016 to edit date (sc). (Entered: 03/01/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste: Sentencing held on 4/21/2016 for Carmen Odalis Flores-Davila (14). Present: SAUSA Laura G. Montes, Atty. Wilfredo Rios, USPO Malissa Aponte. Defendant was OB, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. No objections to the PSI Report. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's complete psychiatric record to be submitted as part of her BOP record. The Court imposed a variance sentence based on defendant's personal characteristics, including her mental conditions. The sentence imposed is below the advisory guideline range. Count 1, IMPR for 48 months; SRT of 5 years; SMA of $100.00. Defendant shall voluntary surrender to the USM for this district upon designation. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:36.Hearing ended at 10:56.Interpreter Enith Valdes. (dv) (Entered: 04/27/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Kevin Reyes-Santiago (20) held on 1/10/2017. Present were AUSA Laura Montes and defense counsel Leonardo Aldridge. Defendant was on bond, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U.S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Jay Garcia-Gregory, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) -Straight Plea- of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report Sentencing Hearing is set for 5/10/2017 at 2:00 PM in Courtroom 6 before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:30 pm. Hearing held at 3:40 pm. Hearing ended at 4:06 pm. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (cmd) Modified on 1/12/2017 to correct text that defendant was on bond (mr). Certified Copy of Order from USCA as to Luis Pintor (5), Ashley Flores-Carter (8) entered on 01/11/17 re: 1091 Notice of Appeal - Final Judgment; Defendant's motion to obtain the change of plea and sentencing hearing transcripts of codefendant Luis Pintor is resolved as follows. Defendant's request for the plea transcript is DENIED. As for defendant's request for the sentencing transcript, we note that some of the docket entries concerning Pintor's sentencing are limited to "selected parties" only and are not publicly available. Therefore, we authorize Pintor's sentencing hearing to be transcribed, but before the transcript is filed on the public docket, the district court should determine whether the sentencing transcript is subject to the same "selected parties" restriction. If the district court determines that the transcript is subject to the same restriction, defendant should request permission from the district court to access the transcript. A copy of this order shall be provided to the district court in Pintor's case, P.R. Case No. 3:15-cr-608-PAD-5. s/c: CSM B. Agostini (xi). (Entered: 01/11/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Anibal Torres-Perez (25) held on 4/20/2017. AUSA Marie C. Amy and defense counsel Wilfredo Diaz were present. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. The government was heard and requested a minimum of 6 months of imprisonment. Defendant's allocution was heard. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term. Therefore, the terms of supervised release imposed in this case is hereby revoked. It is the judgment of the Court, that defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the of the U.S. BOP to be imprisoned for a term of six (6) months. Time served to be credited. Supervised release term of four (4) years. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (USPO Sherley Aponte.) ORDER as to Kevin Reyes-Santiago (20): The parties are reminded of the Court's Standing Order of 11/28/2012 on Straight Plea cases. The Court requires that both parties express their respective positions regarding the sentence through a sentencing memorandum. These memoranda are mandatory; the Court will not sentence a defendant without the benefit of the same. The defendant's memorandum is due 30 days after the change of plea hearing is held. The Government's memorandum is due 30 days thereafter. However, sentencing memoranda are to be filed no later than ten (10) days prior to the sentencing hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Sentencing held on 5/10/2017 for Kevin Reyes-Santiago (20). SAUSA Vanessa Bonano (stood in for AUSA Laura Montes) and defense counsel Leonardo Aldridge were present. Defendant was present, on bond and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. The Court granted counsel five (5) days to produce translations to the letters attached in the sentencing memorandum. The Court entered into a variance sentence that it be just and not greater than necessary. Sentence imposed as to Count(s) 1, IMPR: 12 months and 1 day. SRT: 3 years. SMA: $100.00. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. Defense counsel requested that defendant voluntary surrender on 5/16/2017 at mid-day to the U.S. Marshals. Although, the government may object, the Court granted the request, since defendant has been complying with his bail release conditions. Defense does not anticipate to file an appeal. However, counsel will reach out to AUSA Montes and find out if they have intentions to appeal. If the government is not incline to appeal and with permission from the Court, defense counsel requested not to file the translations. The Court granted the request. (USPO Wilmarisa Martinez.) (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 04:05. Hearing ended at 04:37. Interpreter Heidi Cazes. (br) (Entered: 05/11/2017)

COPY OF ORDER denying 1230 Motion to Vacate (2255) as to Luis Rivera-Ramos (1) filed in 17-cv-1197-JAG, Order re Magistrate Judge's 35 Report & Recommendation on Petitioner's 1 Motion to Vacate, Set Aside or Correct Sentence under 28 U.S.C. § 2255: Petitioner's 40 Objection thereto reiterates arguments presented to--and addressed by-- the Magistrate Judge in the Report & Recommendation. See Rojas-Buscaglia v. Taburno-Vasarely, 39 F. Supp. 3d 208, 211 n.1 (D.P.R. 2014) (noting that de novo review is unwarranted where the objections are repetitive of the arguments already made to the magistrate judge). The Court, finding no clear error in the Magistrate Judge's conclusions vis-a-vis those arguments, ADOPTS the 35 Report & Recommendation and, for the reasons stated therein, DENIES Petitioner's 1 Motion under 28 U.S.C. § 2255. The Court will enter Judgment separately. Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia- Gregory on 1/29/2020. (mcm)  Civil Case 3:17-cv-01197-JAG closed. Modified on 1/30/2020 to edit docket title (mem). (Entered: 01/30/2020)

ORDER denying without prejudice 1465 Motion to Reduce Sentence - First Step Act as to Ruben Barcelo-Severino (2); noted 1471 Motion in Compliance as to Ruben Barcelo- Severino (2); noted 1479 Motion in Compliance as to Ruben Barcelo-Severino (2). Defendant has failed to meet his burden of establishing that compassionate release is warranted pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(1)(A). Specifically, Defendant has failed to establish: (1) exhaustion of administrative remedies, (2) that he does not pose a danger to the community; and (3) that a sentence reduction is consistent with 18 U.S.C. 3553(a) and the applicable policy statements issued by the Sentencing Commission. If the Court were to excuse the exhaustion of administrative remedies, Defendant provided some evidence showing he suffers from obesity, which according to the CDC places Defendant at an increased risk of severe illness from COVID-19. His medical condition- -coupled with the fact that FCI Marianna currently has 15 cases of COVID among the staff, 249 recovered inmates, and 40 recovered staff--might be sufficient to establish extraordinary and compelling circumstances. However, Defendant has failed to show that he does not pose a danger to the community, considering the crime of conviction and his leadership role in the offense; or that a sentence reduction would be consistent with 18 U.S.C. 3553(a) and the applicable policy statements, considering that Defendant has served less than 40% of his sentence of imprisonment. For these reasons, Defendant's Motion is hereby DENIED without prejudice. Defendant may refile the present motion provided he submits evidence to satisfy the requirements of 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(1)(A). Finally, Defendant has failed to show that this Court has jurisdiction over any request for home confinement, considering that the BOP is solely responsible for determining an inmate's place of incarceration. See 18 U.S.C. § 3621(b). Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 3/10/2021. (MQ) (Entered: 03/10/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Lynn Ramos (23) held on 3/19/2021. Present: AUSA Daniel Olinghouse, AFPD Alejandra Bird and USPO Alejandro Martinez. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived her right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Martinez at Docket No. 1486 . The defendant was also advised of her rights, including her right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. AFPD Bird argued for conditions of release pending the final hearing. The Government requested detention. USPO Martinez's statements were heard. After having heard the parties, the Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States' case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 3/29/2021 02:00 PM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan.The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English Language. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing held at 03:52.Hearing ended at 04:22 Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 03/24/2021)
